snippet: Officials said Friday that they would use a retooled state health exchange website for this fall’s open enrollment period.
abstract: Massachusetts officials say they will use a retooled state health exchange website for fall 2014 open enrollment period; Massachusetts Health Connector was established by the state’s 2006 health overhaul law, but it sputtered when it was updated to comply with the Affordable Care Act, sending 250,000 people to temporary coverage.
lead_paragraph: Officials said Friday that they would use a retooled state health exchange website for this fall’s open enrollment period.

headline.main: Massachusetts: Health Site Will Stay State-Based
headline.print_headline: Massachusetts: Health Site Will Stay State-Based

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
